div.head: CHAP. VI.

1 Wee may not liue in sinne, 2 for wee are dead vnto it, 3 as appeareth by our baptisme. 12 Let not sinne raigne any more, 18 because wee haue yeelded our selues to the seruice of righteousnesse, 23 and for that death is the wages of sinne.
div.ab: What shall we say then? shall wee continue in sinne: that grace may abound?
God forbid: how shall wee that are dead to sinne, liue any longer therein?
Know ye not, that so many of vs as were baptized into Iesus Christ, were baptized into his death? Or, are.
Therefore wee are buryed with him by baptisme into death, that like as Christ was raised vp from the dead by the glorie of the Father: euen so wee also should walke in newnesse of life.
For if we haue bene planted together in the likenesse of his death: wee shalbe also in the likenesse of his resurrection:
Knowing this, that our old man is crucified with him, that the bodie of sinne might bee destroyed, that hencefoorth we should not serue sinne.
For he that is dead, is freed from sinne. Gr. iustified
Now if we be dead with Christ, we beleeue that we shal also liue with him:
Knowing that Christ being raysed from the dead, dieth no more, death hath no more dominion ouer him.
For in that he dyed, he dyed vnto sinne once: but in that hee liueth, hee liueth vnto God.
Likewise reckon yee also your selues to be dead indeed vnto sinne: but aliue vnto God, through Iesus Christ our Lord.
Let not sinne reigne therfore in your mortall body, that ye should obey it in the lusts thereof.

Neither yeeld yee your members as instruments of vnrighteousnes vnto sinne: but yeelde your selues vnto God, as those that are aliue from the dead, and your members as instruments of righteousnesse vnto God. Gr. armes, or weapons.
For sinne shall not haue dominion ouer you, for yee are not vnder the Law, but vnder Grace.
What then? shal we sinne, because wee are not vnder the Law, but vnder Grace? God forbid.
Know ye not, that to whom yee yeeld your selues seruants to obey, his seruants ye are to whom ye obey: whether of sinne vnto death, or of obedience vnto righteousnesse?
But God bee thanked, that yee were the seruants of sinne: but ye haue obeyed from the heart that fourme of doctrine, which was deliuered you. Gr. whereto ye were deliuered.
Being then made free from sinne, yee became the seruants of righteousnesse.

I speake after the maner of men, because of the infirmitie of your flesh: for as yee haue yeelded your members seruants to vncleannesse and to iniquitie, vnto iniquitie: euen so now yeelde your members seruants to righteousnesse, vnto holinesse.
For when yee were the seruants of sinne ye were free from righteousnesse. Gr. to righteousnesse.
What fruit had yee then in those things, whereof ye are now ashamed? for the end of those things is death.
But now being made free from sinne, and become seruants to God, yee haue your fruit vnto holinesse, and the end euerlasting life.
For the wages of sinne is death: but the gift of God is eternall life, through Iesus Christ our Lord.
